issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.environment:
Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.0.201106071155
Android 2.2 Emulator Google API's
Titanium Mobile SDK 1.7

comments.body:
In order for us to progress this issue, please edit your ticket to include a proper [Use-case|http://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/Contributing+to+Titanium#ContributingtoTitanium-CreatingGoodUsecases]. To clarify, the script should run without modification when added to a blank app.js.  Hence, where is the window created? You should include this, so that the core devs can replicate the behavior in the quickest time.

Please ensure you format your ticket using the wiki markup provided.

Also, please state the Titanium SDK build date and hash.


Thank you

This does not work as you expect because the Titanium API is not recognized when embedded in remote HTML web pages. Please see [this Q&A answer|http://developer.appcelerator.com/question/116950/tiappfireevent--webview--api-16-issue#answer-208695] for further explanation.
The behavior is as expected. See explanation and solution [here|http://developer.appcelerator.com/question/116950/tiappfireevent--webview--api-16-issue#answer-208695]
